intro: Frailea ignacionensis, commonly known as the Ignacio's stonecabbage, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to the arid regions of northern Chile, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, low-growing form and its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy stems. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the spring and early summer. Frailea ignacionensis is a slow-growing cactus that is well adapted to harsh desert conditions.
